analysis.project_name: Neon Eye Tracker Integration for Multimodal Face Analysis Engine

request_intention.primary_goal: Integrate Pupil Labs Neon eye tracker streaming capabilities into existing multimodal face analysis architecture
specific_requirements: Add new stream type for eye tracking data to existing stream synchronization engine
Recreate all open-neon API functionality within current architectural patterns
Maintain functional programming approach with factory functions and immutable objects
Ensure compatibility with existing stream synchronization and transport infrastructure
Support real-time 200Hz eye tracking data streaming with sub-50ms latency
request_intention.integration_scope: Full functionality recreation - not dependency addition

project_overview.name: open-neon-js-api
project_overview.description: LLM-friendly JavaScript/TypeScript API for Pupil Labs Neon eye tracker with semantic data enhancement
project_overview.primary_purpose: Research-grade eye tracking API for Node.js and browsers with 200Hz real-time gaze streaming

architecture_principles.coding_paradigm: Functional composition over classes - matches our existing patterns
architecture_principles.type_safety: TypeScript via JSDoc annotations - matches our approach
architecture_principles.module_system: ES modules with factory functions - identical to our patterns
architecture_principles.error_handling: Functional error handling with explicit error types
architecture_principles.dependency_philosophy: Zero runtime dependencies with performance optimization

package_structure.core: Shared types, utilities, and business logic with Observable implementation
package_structure.node: Node.js-specific implementation with full protocol support (WebSocket, HTTP, mDNS)
package_structure.streaming: Universal streaming adapter supporting MQTT, UDP, TCP, WebSocket protocols

streaming_capabilities.video_frames: Raw pixel data from eye cameras with timestamp synchronization
streaming_capabilities.eye_state: Detailed pupil diameter, eyeball center, optical axis measurements
streaming_capabilities.events: Blink detection, fixation tracking, saccade identification

device_control.connection_management: Auto-discovery via mDNS, connection state management
device_control.status_monitoring: Battery level, charging state, device health

data_enhancement.llm_friendly_formats: Structured responses with natural language descriptions
data_enhancement.quality_assessment: Confidence levels, tracking stability, calibration quality
data_enhancement.behavioral_interpretation: Attention levels, gaze patterns, engagement metrics

performance_optimization.custom_observable: 4000x faster than RxJS with Bun runtime
performance_optimization.zero_dependencies: 315KB bundle size reduction through custom implementations

transport_protocols.mqtt: IoT ecosystem integration with QoS support
transport_protocols.udp: Ultra-low latency streaming for specialized applications

data_flow_patterns.observable_streams: Custom Observable implementation with functional composition
data_flow_patterns.event_driven: Event emitters for connection state, errors, status updates
data_flow_patterns.backpressure_handling: Stream buffer management with configurable limits
data_flow_patterns.error_recovery: Exponential backoff retry with circuit breaker patterns

synchronization_approach.timestamp_precision: High-precision timestamps with hardware synchronization support
synchronization_approach.multi_stream_coordination: Synchronized streaming of gaze, video, IMU, and event data
synchronization_approach.quality_monitoring: Real-time stream quality assessment and adaptation

core_types.GazeData: Normalized coordinates (0-1) with confidence and timestamp
core_types.VideoFrame: Raw pixel data with format specification and timing
core_types.EyeState: Detailed eye measurements including pupil diameter and optical axis
core_types.CalibrationData: Calibration points, quality metrics, and validation results

semantic_enhancements.GazeSemanticData: Human-readable descriptions, screen regions, quality assessments
semantic_enhancements.GazeContextData: Device health, calibration quality, environmental conditions
semantic_enhancements.GazeDerivedData: Screen coordinates, attention levels, gaze patterns
semantic_enhancements.behavioral_classification: Fixation, saccade, smooth pursuit pattern identification

compatibility_requirements.hardware_dependency: Requires Pupil Labs Neon eye tracker hardware

device_discovery.solution: Abstract discovery behind factory interface with platform adapters
device_discovery.implementation: Optional dependency strategy for discovery services

high_frequency_streaming.challenge: 200Hz data rate may overwhelm existing synchronization engine
high_frequency_streaming.solution: Implement adaptive batching and buffering strategies
high_frequency_streaming.implementation: Extend existing buffer management with high-frequency optimizations

hardware_dependency.challenge: Requires physical Neon device for development and testing
hardware_dependency.solution: Comprehensive mock implementation following open-neon test patterns
hardware_dependency.implementation: Mock device server with realistic data generation

protocol_complexity.challenge: Multiple protocols (WebSocket, HTTP, mDNS) increase complexity
protocol_complexity.implementation: Extend existing transport factory with protocol-specific implementations

architectural_extensions_needed.current_architecture_assessment: âœ… Excellent foundation - minimal changes required

discovery_service.rationale: Eye trackers require network discovery, unlike static face analysis
discovery_service.implementation: Optional service that extends transport factory

device_lifecycle_management.rationale: Eye trackers have connection states, battery, calibration status
device_lifecycle_management.implementation: State management following existing orchestrator patterns
device_lifecycle_management.impact: Medium - new concept but follows existing patterns

high_frequency_optimization.implementation: Extend existing buffer implementation with batching strategies
high_frequency_optimization.impact: Low - enhancement of existing synchronization engine

semantic_data_processing.rationale: Eye tracking benefits from human-readable interpretations
semantic_data_processing.implementation: Data transformation pipelines using existing processor patterns
semantic_data_processing.impact: Medium - new functionality but follows established patterns

architectural_extensions_needed.no_breaking_changes: All extensions designed to maintain 100% backward compatibility

hardware_testing.question: How to handle development without physical Neon hardware?
options: Use comprehensive mock implementation from open-neon project
Create hardware abstraction layer for testing
Implement simulator with realistic data patterns
hardware_testing.recommendation: Use mock implementation with option to connect to real hardware when available

performance_scaling.question: How will 200Hz eye tracking affect overall system performance?
options: Implement adaptive quality scaling based on system load
Use separate processing threads for eye tracking streams
Implement intelligent batching and buffering strategies
performance_scaling.recommendation: Combine adaptive batching with performance monitoring

data_storage.question: How to handle storage and export of high-frequency eye tracking data?
options: Extend existing data export with eye tracking formats
Implement streaming data persistence with configurable retention
Create specialized eye tracking data analysis tools
data_storage.recommendation: Start with basic export extension, evolve based on research needs

calibration_integration.question: How to coordinate eye tracker calibration with face analysis calibration?
options: Independent calibration systems with optional coordination
Unified calibration manager for all modalities
Sequential calibration with shared coordinate systems
calibration_integration.recommendation: Independent systems with coordination hooks for multimodal applications
